title: Rust 1.18 regression, quick-error 1.1.0

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-beta
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to beta.

body:
https://github.com/tailhook/quick-error

```
brian@ip-10-145-43-250:~/dev/quick-error⟫ git log -1
commit 5e59eb822cb01a5c33323c3dc919793a178bdf8e
Author: Paul Colomiets <paul@colomiets.name>
Date:   Sat Jun 4 13:20:37 2016 +0300

    Version bumped to v1.1.0
```

```
brian@ip-10-145-43-250:~/dev/quick-error⟫ cargo +beta test
   Compiling quick-error v1.1.0 (file:///mnt2/dev/quick-error)
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 1.69 secs
     Running target/debug/deps/quick_error-467b2d09fb8da02d

running 16 tests
test test::bare_item_trait ... ok
test test::bare_item_direct ... ok
test test::debug_context ... ok
test test::parse_float_error ... ok
test test::parse_int_error ... ok
test test::struct_wrapper_excess_comma ... ok
test test::struct_wrapper_err ... ok
test test::path_context ... FAILED
test test::struct_wrapper_struct_from ... ok
test test::tuple_wrapper_discard ... ok
test test::tuple_wrapper_err ... ok
test test::tuple_wrapper_from ... ok
test test::tuple_wrapper_singleton ... ok
test test::tuple_wrapper_trait_str ... ok
test test::tuple_wrapper_trait_two_fields ... ok
test test::tuple_wrapper_custom_from ... ok

failures:

---- test::path_context stdout ----
        thread 'test::path_context' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)` (left: `"Path error at \"/etc\": invalid utf-8 sequence of 1 bytes from index 1"`, right: `"Path error at \"/etc\": invalid utf-8: invalid byte near index 1"`)', src/lib.rs:1122
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.


failures:
    test::path_context

test result: FAILED. 15 passed; 1 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured

error: test failed, to rerun pass '--lib'
```

This looks like quick-error's test suite was depending on the text of an error message, so I doubt we'll do anything here, but interesting to note.

cc @tailhook
